h.en: The First Rung on the Ladder

s.gd: ’S e taigh beag a bha aig Pòl MacRath, le dà rùm agus clòsaid agus teàrr anairt air a mhullach.
s.en: Paul McRae had a little house, with two rooms and a closet and tarred cloth on its roof.

s.gd: Cha robh croit aige, ach bhiodh e a’ cur cliabh buntàta ann an croit a nàbaidh.
s.en: He did not have a croft, but he would plant a grid of potatoes in his neighbour’s croft.

s.gd: ’S e duine beag, lag agus caran uireasbhach a bh’ ann.
s.en: He was a little man, weak and somewhat defective.

s.gd: Cha dèanadh e iasgach no seòladh, oir cha robh am muir a’ tighinn air.
s.en: He wouldn’t do fishing or sailing, because the sea did not suit him.

s.gd: Cha robh a shlàinte ach meadhanach, agus dh’fhàg sin e ceum nas bochda na a’ mhòr-chuid sa bhaile, ach bha e glè mhùirneach aig Eilidh, a bhean, agus aig Seòras a mhac.
s.en: His health was but middling, and that left him a step poorer than the majority in the town, but he was very fond of Helen, his wife, and of George his son.

s.gd: Cha robh e ag iarraidh san t-saoghal ach dà rud: obair aotrom agus cead suidhe aig Bòrd an Tighearna.
s.en: He only wanted two things in the world: light work and permission to sit at the Lord’s Table.

s.gd: Bha Seòras còig bliadhna deug a dh’aois, agus ged a bha e a’ dèanamh glè mhath san sgoil, thàinig air a fàgail, oir bha an àrd-sgoil sa bhaile mhòr agus bha an t-airgead gann.
s.en: George was fifteen years old, and although he was doing very well at the school, he had to leave it, because the high school was in the city and money was scarce.

s.gd: Rinn e gàrradh beag air beulaibh an taighe, rud glè annasach sa bhaile bheag againne aig an àm.
s.en: He made a little garden in fron of the house, something very unusual in our little town at the time.

s.gd: Bhiodh e a’ dol air thuarastal a ghearradh mhònach ’s a spealadh arbhair, ach bha fios aige nach robh adhartas an sin idir.
s.en: He would go for wages to cut peat and to scythe corn, but he knew that there was no advancement there at all.

s.gd: Dh’fheumadh e faighinn air a’ chiad rong de dh’fhàradh obair bhuan.
s.en: He had to get on the first rung of the ladder of durable work.

s.gd: Chaidh Pòl uair is uair gu àitichean san robh obair air tòiseachadh, ach bha am mì-fhortan ga leantainn gus na thòisich companaidh a’ cur phìoban tron mhòintich airson uisge a’ bhaile mhòir.
s.en: Paul went time and again to places where work had started, but misfortune followed him until a company started laying pipes through the hills for the city’s water.

s.gd: Choisich Pòl seachd mìle dhan mhonadh agus lorg e maor na h-obrach ann an seada faisg air an rathad.
s.en: Paul walked seven miles to the hills and he found the foreman an a shed near the road.

s.gd: Dh’aithnich an duine sin e, oir bha e air fhaicinn aig àitichean eile a’ lorg car obrach.
s.en: That man recognised him, because he had seen him at other places looking for bits of work.

s.gd: “Tha an obair seo fada ro throm air do shon,” ars esan.
Bha Pòl air seo a chluinntinn tric, agus rinn e airson falbh, ach stad am maor e.
Rinn e sgrìobhadh air pìos pàipeir agus thug e do Phòl e.
“Theirig gu talla a’ bhaile mhòir,” ars esan, “agus faic an duine sin.
’S e mo bhràthair a th’ ann agus tha e a’ lorg luchd-obrach an-dràsta.”
